title: Israel-Hamas war: The deadly targeting of hospitals in Gaza
summary: The Israeli army has taken over multiple hospitals at the cost of considerable human and material damage.

title: UN Security Council passes Gaza aid resolution without calling for ceasefire
summary: The Council voted on Friday to approve a resolution demanding all sides of the conflict allow 'safe and unhindered delivery of humanitarian assistance at scale.'

title: Man City confirmed as world's best club in 2023 after winning fifth trophy
summary: The European champions, who came under Emirati ownership in 2008, succeed Real Madrid, five-time winners of the Club World Cup.

title: Two people in custody after France grounds plane carrying 300 Indians over suspected 'human trafficking'
summary: Special investigators are questioning all those aboard, the Paris prosecutor’s office said in a statement. Human trafficking carries a potential sentence of up to 20 years in France.

title: In Central America, a press freedom crisis is quietly unfolding
summary: Faced with attacks from authoritarian regimes, journalists in the region are trying to organize to counter the rampant exile into which they are being forced. New methods of investigation and sharing information are emerging.

title: A Parisian chocolatier revives ganache with panache
summary: The 'purveyor to the kings' Debauve et Gallais has spruced up its historic Paris boutique, bringing back old chocolate recipes that have delighted chocolate lovers for years.

title: Supreme Court declines to fast-track ruling in Trump election subversion case
summary: The former American president's lawyers claim that Donald Trump enjoys "absolute immunity" for his actions while in the White House. The Supreme Court, which has a 6-3 conservative majority, includes three justices nominated by Trump.

title: Nikki Haley promises Republicans calm rather than 'chaos'
summary: The former governor and ambassador's style is in marked contrast to that of former president Trump, the primary favorite, as she aims to distance herself from him without alienating his supporters.

title: Czech Republic mourns after worst mass shooting
summary: People in the Czech Republic will observe a minute's silence on Saturday to remember those killed after a student opened fire at Prague's Charles University on Thursday, killing 13 people and wounding 25 others.

title: In Jordan, Macron and King Abdullah II seek to maintain ties
summary: The war between Israel and Hamas has highlighted differences and raised tensions between France and its 'strategic partner' in the region.

title: Gazprom's shadow looms over one of the French Riviera's most luxurious villas
summary: Officially owned by a Russian-Armenian billionaire, Villa del Mare is linked to the Russian gas giant through a string of companies. French authorities have opened an investigation into money laundering.

title: UK police launch child abduction probe over teenager Alex Batty found in France
summary: Greater Manchester Police said it had 'launched a criminal investigation into child abduction to understand the circumstances surrounding' the 17-year-old's disappearance.

title: Biden pardons thousands convicted of marijuana charges
summary: No federal prisoners are eligible for release as a result of Friday's action, but the pardons were meant to help thousands overcome obstacles to renting a home or finding a job.

title: Russian war deserter forced to return after detention in Armenia
summary: Dmitri Sedrakov was kidnapped by Russian soldiers on December 7. His arrest indicates a rising threat to the safety of thousands of Russian deserters who fled abroad.

title: Trump pressured Michigan officials not to certify 2020 vote, recording reveals
summary: The former president pressured two election officials not to certify 2020 vote totals in a key Michigan county, according to a recording disclosed in a report by The Detroit News.

title: US to target banks that help Russia finance its war in Ukraine
summary: The world's largest economy warned financial institutions that they had a 'very stark choice' between funding Russia's war in Ukraine or being 'connected' to the US financial system.

title: French foreign intelligence agents detained in Burkina Faso
summary: French diplomats played down the incident, but the arrest of four members of the General Directorate of External Security (DGSE) for 'espionage' reflects the deterioration in relations between the two countries.

title: In Corinth, remains of port activity date back to 1200 BC
summary: An international team of archaeologists working on the origins of the ancient port – dated to the seventh century BC – has discovered that it was in operation half a millennium before that time, in the Bronze Age.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Israeli army keeps Palestinian reporters in their line of sights
summary: The International Federation of Journalists is accusing Israel's troops of 'deliberately targeting' media professionals working in the Gaza Strip. More than 60 journalists have been killed since the start of the conflict on October 7.

title: 'With open relationships, I realized that I no longer wanted to belong to anyone'
summary: 'First times': Our series on pivotal moments during the transition to adulthood. This week, 23-year-old Ninon (first name changed), who has been in an open relationship for almost two years, describes how she discovered this new form of love.

title: France completes troop withdrawal from Niger, closes embassy
summary: The withdrawal of troops was completed on Friday, in compliance with the orders from Niger's military junta. In a rare move, France also decided to close its embassy in Niamey.

title: The Channel Tunnel's operator dreams of expanding into the rest of Europe
summary: Because of Brexit and social dumping by ferry companies, the Channel Tunnel is gradually losing market shares. The operator, Getlink – whose workers went on strike on Thursday – has plans to develop rail connections with Cologne, Geneva and Marseille.

title: Côte d'Ivoire: Banker Tidjane Thiam elected leader of opposition  party
summary: With this election, the Democratic Party (PDCI) hopes to rejuvenate its image following the death of its former leader Henri Konan Bedie, in early August at the age of 89.

title: 'The Bank of Japan in an inflation dilemma'
summary: Japan – which is experiencing a weak surge in inflation – is reluctant to wield the weapon of higher interest rates, explains economist Sébastien Lechevalier in his column in 'Le Monde.'

title: UN demands more aid for Gaza, but no truce
summary: Five days of tense negotiations were necessary to prevent another veto from the United States, which opposed calling for a 'cessation of hostilities.'

title: 'On immigration as on Depardieu, Culture Minister Abdul Malak stands against Macron and much of public opinion'
summary: Hurt by the measures in the immigration law and disavowed by the president on her condemnation of the rape-accused actor, Rima Abdul Malak has decided to remain in office to fight against the far right, observes Le Monde's culture columnist Michel Guerrin.
